description.en: Test study used to show the features of Rodano

introductionText:
Rodano Test Study

This study is not a real study, all data are dummy records. The purpose of this website is to illustrate the features of a typical study built with Rodano.

shortname.en: Patient participates in an interventional study (with an IMP)

advancedHelp.en:
1. Normal
  2. Abnormal signs without disability
  3. Minimal disability
  4. Mild or moderate paraparesis or hemiparesis (detectable weakness but most sustained for short periods, fatigue a problem); severe monoparesis (almost no function)
  5. Marked paraparesis or hemiparesis (function is difficult); moderate quadriparesis (function is decreased but can be sustained for short periods); or monoplegia
  6. Paraplegia, hemiplegia or marked quadriparesis
  7. Quadriplegia

1. Normal
  2. Abnormal signs without disability
  3. Mild ataxia
  4. Moderate truncal or limb ataxia (tremor or clumsy movements interfere with function in all spheres)
  5. Severe ataxia in all limbs (most function is very difficult)
  6. Unable to perform co-ordinated movements due to ataxia

1. Normal
  2. Signs only
  3. Moderate nystagmus or other mild disability
  4. Severe nystagmus, marked extraocular weakness or moderate disability of other cranial nerves
  5. Marked dysarthria or other marked disability
  6. Inability to swallow or speak

1. Normal
  2. Vibration or figure-writing decrease, only in one or two limbs
  3. Mild decrease in touch or pain or position sense, and/or moderate decrease in vibration in one or two limbs; or vibratory decrease alone in three or four limbs
  4. Moderate decrease in touch or pain or position sense, and/or essentially lost vibration in one or two limbs; or mild decrease in touch or pain and/or moderate decrease in all proprioceptive tests in three or four limbs
  5. Marked decrease in touch or pain or loss of proprioception, alone or combined, in one or two limbs; or moderate decrease in touch or pain and/or severe proprioceptive decrease in more than two limbs
  6. Loss of sensation in one or two limbs; or proprioception for most of the body below the head
  7. Sensation essentially lost below the head

1. Normal
  2. Mild urinary hesitancy, urgency or retention
  3. Moderate hesitancy, urgency, retention of bowel or bladder, or rare urinary incontinence (intermittent self-catheterisation, manual compression to evacuate bladder or finger evacuation of stool)
  4. Frequent urinary incontinence
  5. In need of regular intermittent catheterisation (and constant use of measures to evacuate stool)
  6. Indwelling catheter
  7. Loss or bowel and bladder function

1. Normal
  2. Scotoma with visual acuity (corrected) better than 6/9
  3. Worse eye with maximal visual acuity (corrected) of 6/9 - 6/12
  4. Worse eye with maximal visual acuity (corrected) of 6/18 - 6/24
  5. Worse eye with maximal visual acuity (corrected) of 6/36 - 6/60 or grade 3 plus maximal acuity of better eye of 6/18 or less
  6. Worse eye with maximal visual acuity (corrected) of 6/60 or grade 4 plus maximal acuity of better eye of 6/18 or less
  7. Grade 5 plus maximal visual acuity of better eye worse than 6/18

1. Normal
  2. Mood alteration only, fatigue not interfering with daily activity (does not affect EDSS score)
  3. Mild decrease in mentation, fatigue interfering with daily activity
  4. Moderate decrease in mentation
  5. Marked decrease in mentation (chronic brain syndrome - moderate)
  6. Dementia or chronic brain syndrom - severe or incompetent

advancedHelp.en:
1. Fully ambulatory
  2. About 500 meters without aid or rest
  3. About 300 meters without aid or rest
  4. About 200 meters without aid or rest
  5. About 100 meters without aid or rest
  6. About 100 meters with unilateral assistance
  7. About 20 meters with bilateral assistance
  8. Essentially restricted to wheelchair (wheels self)
  9. Restricted to wheelchair (may need help in transfer)
  10. Essentially restricted to bed or chair
  11. Restricted to bed much of the day
  12. Bed patient, can communicate and eat
  13. Helpless bed patient, unable to communicate, eat or swallow

We would like to know how good or bad your health is today from 0 to 100

advancedHelp.en:
This scale is numbered from 0 to 100.
100 means the best health you can imagine.
0 means the worst health you can imagine.

shortname.en: In general, would you say your health is
Compared to one year ago, how would you rate your health in general now?
Much better now than one year ago
Somewhat better now than one year ago
Somewhat worse now than one year ago
Much worse now than one year ago
Does your health now limit you in vigorous activities, such as running, lifting heavy objects, participating in strenuous sports? If so, how much?
Does your health now limit you in moderate activities, such as moving a table, pushing a vacuum cleaner, bowling, or playing golf? If so, how much?
Does your health now limit you in lifting or carrying groceries? If so, how much?
Does your health now limit you in climbing several flights of stairs? If so, how much?
Does your health now limit you in climbing one flight of stairs? If so, how much?
Does your health now limit you in bending, kneeling, or stooping? If so, how much?

description.en: List of all Disease Modifying Treatments

textBefore.en: History of Disease Modifying Treatments, including systemic steroids and MS symptomatic medications. Please complete or update the list as appropriate.

Relapses since the last visit

A relapse or exacerbation is defined as the appearance of a new symptom or group of symptoms or worsening / re-appearance of an old symptom attributable to MS, lasting at least 24 hours in the absence of fever, and preceded by stability or improvement for at least 30 days.

Inclusion Criteria

  • Patient is 18 years old or more
  • Patient has an EDSS score lower than 7.0
  • Patient has read, understood, signed and dated informed consent form

Exclusion Criteria

  • Patient receives or is planned to receive during the course of this study any investigational drug or experimental procedure
  • Patient suffers from dementia in the opinion of the investigator
  • Patient suffers of major medical or psychiatric illness in the opinion of the investigator
List of children. Please complete or update the list as appropriate.

requiredSignatureText.en:
By my dated signature below, I confirm that I have personally examined all of the observations recorded in this electronic Case Report Form for completeness and accuracy. All information entered by me or by my colleagues is correct to the best of my knowledge.

Pursuant to Section 11.100 of Title 21 of the Code of Federal Regulations, I certify that this electronic signature is intended to be the legally binding equivalent of my handwritten signature.

To this I do attest by supplying my password and clicking the button marked "Sign" below.
